means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 里奇地貌名称，来源于中世纪英语、古英语，含义是“岭”(ridge)
[人名] [爱尔兰姓氏] 里奇盖尔语姓氏的英译，来源于别名，含义是“岭之猎犬”(hound of the ridge)

word_mean: 嵴，脊：突起或突起结构，另见crest和crista
水平气压场上, 等压线向气压较低一方突出的脊状部分。

sentence.Network_en: Every man who could fight was now committed to defend the ridge.
sentence.Network_cn: 每个能够参加战斗的男子现在都决心要保卫这条山脊。

sentence.Network_en: Even among seasoned mountaineers Pinnacle Ridge is considered quite a tough proposition.
sentence.Network_cn: 即使在经验丰富的登山者中，平纳克尔峰也被认为是很难攀登的。

sentence.Network_en: The fawn ran to the top of the ridge.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English hrycg 'spine, crest', of Germanic origin; related to Dutch rug and German Rücken 'back'

entry.def: A ridge is a long, narrow piece of raised land.
A ridge is a raised line on a flat surface.

example.ex: ...the bony ridge of the eye socket.

means.word_mean: 1. a long narrow natural elevation or striation
3. a long narrow range of hills
4. any long raised border or margin of a bone or tooth or membrane
5. a beam laid along the ridge of a roof; provides attachment for upper end of rafters
2. plough alternate strips by throwing the furrow onto an unploughed strip
3. throw soil toward (a crop row) from both sides;
4. spade into alternate ridges and troughs;
